docs.summary:
The CAPTCHA API is used to display a modal that presents a challenge-response test to site visitors 
to determine whether they are human or a bot.
description: Use a reCAPTCHA challenge-response test to verify that site visitors are human before allowing them to perform
To ensure complete protection, you must include backend [authorization](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-captcha-backend/authorize)
as a mandatory step of the CAPTCHA validation lifecycle.
To use the CAPTCHA API, import `wixCaptcha` from the `wix-crm` module:

docs.summary: Opens a modal that contains a reCAPTCHA challenge.
description: Following CAPTCHA verification on the client side, you must authorize
the generated CAPTCHA token in the backend. `authorize()` checks if the token
is valid, making sure it was not tampered with or timed out.
